comment: Not working on lollipop 5.0.1

title: Lightweight. How to reset steps to 0?
comment: I find myself going to app settings and erasing the data frequently because there is no reset button. Otherwise I like the simple interface. Physical pedometers have only one button. A reset button. Each time I go for a walk around the neighborhood, I reset the pedometer and at the end I know how many steps I did for that walk. I am not as interested in cumulative steps for the day or week. Where is open source? I don't know Android but maybe i can add a reset menu option.
There is no reset button because I couldn't image any use case for it - why do you need to reset your data?

title: Seems good but....
comment: Update: still mostly fine but occasionally gives me impossibly high step counts.   Using in conjunction with Google Fit seems to help keep app honest. No task killers or battery savers. A new bug is that occasionally I find the pedometer is wildly inaccurate, adding an extra 10-12,000 steps on a given day for no apparent reason. Interestingly, when the information goes into Google fit, it's generally much more accurate.
Do you use any task killer or battery saver apps?

title: can not reset
comment: dumb
Why would you need to reset the data? You can reset it in the Android application settings
Great and accurate App. However, is there a way to "reset" it? Like to zero?
You can clear the app data in the Android settings
Can it be used in not Nexus 5 device such as xperia Z1?
Depends on wheather that device has the necessary step sensor

title: No step history
comment: Seems to work fine, but there's no way to look back at step history. I'm sure it's keeping the data from two weeks ago, but the user can't see it.

title: Make love
comment: Not war

title: Widget doesn't update promptly
comment: 5 star review except for that. And very occasionally (once) it didn't record my day.
Lot to improve. Need to be more accurate. Better history view. Etc
Feel free to contribute to this free open source project. Improving accuracy of your hardware sensor is not possible from a software point of view

title: Easy on battery.  Makes me walk more.
comment: It's the perfect app for me, because I don't have to remember to start it before walking, and I arrive with a full battery.  Thanks!

title: Simply amazing
comment: been using it now for two weeks,  as I have cm12 on my Note 4 and I needed an app for step counting,  works perfectly with out any notable battery drain.  thank you

title: Passive agressive messages when the phone dies
comment: When my phone dies, not only do I have to worry about what actually happened, but apparently I must be killing a kitten or something since I get scolded by this program: "Incorrect shutdown. Use the power button to shutdown the device, otherwise..." and I can't see the rest in the notification. In an FAQ, the developer assumes you use some root method to shutdown, but this is not the case. So, thank you very much for the passive agressive messages. Will you fix my Nexus 6 crashes as well, please?

The message only says that the app will not be able to save your progress if you dont use the power button to shutdown. You dont expect your computer to save whatever you're currently doing when pulling the power plug, do you? Thats not passive aggressive, it's just presenting the facts

title: Wildly inaccurate
comment: So, I did a simple calibration test. I walked 20 normal steps and looked at what it recorded. It got 6 of the steps. Tested it again, walked 15 steps and it got 8 of them. Not sure how it does the counting but it's about as good as just estimating how many steps you've taken in a day and adding or subtracting a random number from your estimate.
If your step sensor is broken, you need to RMA your device. Software cant fix that

title: not able to login
comment: it was working fine earlier now it shows unknown error with play and declines login
I dont havy any influence on Google Play issues
Show distance maybe better

title: Very good but...
comment: PRO - very accurate reading steps - no battery drain. The number of stepts is a little different than what it uploads on GoogleFit but it is really minimal.  Thanks and keep on the good work !!!!

title: Good
comment: Small simple
The best

title: Misses steps
comment: Edit:  Thank you to the author for replying and clearing up my questions. After your explanation I did some experiments. The hardware step sensor in my Note 4 records accurately if I am walking or running steadily for longer distances. However, working in a very busy restaurant, where I walk or run 7,000 to 12,000 steps a night with constant stops, kind of like a basketball player, is mostly not recorded by the hardware step sensor, so this app does not register them. This is not a fault of the app. If I were using this app to record steady walking or running as part of an exercise program it would work fine. This app is simply not for me and I'm raising from 2 to 4 stars.

What you're missing: The app is not repsonsible for recording your steps. It only shows the information from your hardware sensor. "Pedometer (tayutau)" definitly does not use the step sensor, as the app is available for Android 2.3 and the step sensor requires Android 4.4 so I guess they use the acceleration sensors

title: Note 3 neo not supported
comment: It does not work on note 3 neo. Please fix. Highly irritating....
The app requires a device with a hardware step sensor, as it says in the app description...

title: This app is really simple, but it's great to use.
comment: I have been using this app for a couple of weeks now. I have no idea how accurate it is, but I don't care, really. I get a daily goal, and I have to make sure I get above that. That's all I really need.  One thing that would be great, would be if there were more "unlock" features. For the serious walkers, they are all going to be broken pretty quickly (I started 3 weeks ago but I am already on 12/19).  Can you add more unlock features? Fore example, "15 days consecutively walked over target" even up to 1 year. I know it's just numbers, but it's good to have them as fun targets to have.  I like the 1,000,00 steps, but I am at 254,000 steps after 3 weeks. At this rate, all the features will be unlocked within three months.  Thank you.
The best
don't work again.
Please add the function of active time.
Works wonderfully,  but every now and again reports absurdly high step counts. Please fix this bug...

title: Incorrect count
comment: Count doesnt match with google fit
The app does not count your steps, it simply displays the value from your device's step sensor. If you think that one is broken, please contact your device manufacturer
As soon as my lock screen went on my steps went back
Please send me a mail or open a ticket on the github website if you have any issues with the app

title: Suggestion
comment: The app is light weight and great,  could you please add a feature on distance coverage..  It would make the app more better although it is already great.. Also it provides different number of steps compared to Google fit so confused as to which one is accurate.

title: Good light app
comment: The only problem is that it gives different steps from what google fit provides. I don't know which to believe now...

title: Dashclock doesn't update
comment: Like the app, seems accurate and would be 5/5 if the dashclock widget updated the steps.

title: Not accurate
comment: This app is not accurate, and that is on a Nexus 5... One day i walked 6 steps, another 48000.. without even doing that much in difference. I am not recommending this app for its count ability, but it will get two stars for its simple elegant UI. I got a lot of achievements in google play though....
The app does not count your steps, it simply shows the data recorded by your hardware step sensor. If you have an issue with that, please contact your hardware manufacturer
Worked fine before but now it doesn't count steps.

title: Awesome
comment: I really enjoy knowing how many steps I have in a day, but I notice that sometimes it doesn't record anything. When that happens, just reboot the phone. I love that it doesn't take any extra battery to run this app, if that weren't the case I wouldn't use it.
You might need to reboot your device to recalibrate the step sensor, clearing the apps cache won't help

title: Nice....!!!
comment: Though sometimes inaccurate...but considering living in 2014 this is the best..using nexus 5 capabilites to its max...!!!!good work...👍👍😊
No longer works as of 11.12.14.

title: problem when jogging
comment: had to uninstall due inaccuracy when jogging. A 4mi jog would register as 25billion steps, which would then get completely deleted the next day. after jogging for a week, I have no historic data because every day the steps get deleted because it registered them incorrectly. fell back to GoogleFit and RuntasticPro.  It does a good job as a very simple and resource light pedometer.
Stopped working again.

title: Simple and works
comment: It does what I expected it to do. Google fit integration is a plus.
Google fit integration has arrived. Thanks
Accurate and great

title: Doesn't count steps
comment: I have had my phone in my all day and it has counted 9 steps. Incidentally, I have been for a 10km run today. It has also been failing to record my steps properly for the past few days.
The app does not count your steps, it simply shows the data recorded by your hardware step sensor. If you have an issue with that, please contact your hardware manufacturer

title: Very inaccurate
comment: Was 3k steps more than my Fitbit one or google fit.
The app does not count your steps, it simply shows the data recorded by your hardware step sensor. If you have an issue with that, please contact your hardware manufacturer

title: Amazing app. No excess battery use. This is the very best. Bravo
comment: Hip pedometer

title: Inconsistent since Google Fit
comment: Ever since I installed Google Fit this app stopped logging around 50% of my steps.
Yes, I noticed that too. I'll look into that

title: Nice and simple
comment: Simple app that does exactly what it promises. Unfortunately it categorises my bike rides as steps, though I know this is partly a limitation if the hardware itself.

title: Life of its own
comment: Counts steps when I'm on bus, underground, sitting and even sleeping. Inaccurate to the point of useless (I'm on nexus 5 which has an excellent pedometer hardware). Maybe the app could use some smart coding to weed out those false positives?

As said numerous times before: The app does not count your steps, it simply shows the data recorder by your hardware step sensor. If you have an issue with that, please contact your hardware manufacturer

title: 省电，能与Google fit直接相连
comment: 充电的时候还能自定暂停，精确度根据活动。还是本不错的。

title: good so far...very very small and efficient app
Can't save steps on root restart.
comment: Would be nice to make it save steps as it counts. Somehow this doesn't happen to the Google Fit app, steps still there after restart.
Works Great! Would love more statistics and fit integration

title: Excellent app. Needs Google Fit integration now.
comment: Simple, lightweight and accurate. Will give 5 stars if Google Fit integration is added.

title: Great pedometer...
comment: can we let Google Fit app connect to this app? Thanks.... really no battery life kill...   a must have for any phone with hardware pedometer!!
Integrate with Google fit?

title: Seemless
comment: Lightweight. Achievements. Just works. What more can a person ask for?

title: Motivational
comment: Now I walk when I used to take a cab. Want me to help with Pebble integration?

title: Randomly stops with no indication or warning
comment: Randomly stops with no indication or warning. As mentioned by many others, not a issue unique to me. I really like the app but it needs to be more dependable.. EDIT: does NOT save current days steps when you power off via the power button as instructed and I'm not rooted

title: Works on Oneplus One
comment: The app works flawlessly and reliably on my Oneplus One which shares the Snapdragon Hexagon with Nexus 5.

title: Pretty good. Import feature doesn't work
comment: It works for the most part. It doesn't count the steps sometimes if the app isn't launched. Also the import feature doesn't seem to work. If anyone can tell me how that'll be great.
More achievements would be nice :)

title: Erratic!
comment: Been recording steps I didn't take since this update... No... I didn't take those 10k steps!

title: Great!
comment: I'm testing this app, runtastic pedometer and Moves. I can easily say that this app is far more accurate than others! Moves and Runtastic Pedometer are also  using the hardware step-detector on nexus 5 , but somehow they count less steps!

title: Good, but for one bug
comment: Quite often it loses a whole day or two's history. This week for example I've lost Wednesday Thursday and Fridays stats where I've walked at least 18000 steps each day. Still a good app but if this bug could be swished I'd give it 5 stars.

title: Too unreliable
comment: Been using this for several weeks and just uninstalled it today as it's simply too unreliable. As others have mentioned, it sometimes doesn't record anything for hours, then on some days (like today, for example) it records way too many steps... today was a regular work day for me, which means I walk around 5000 steps, but the app reckons I did 11000! Wonder if travelling on the tube triggers steps? Either way, I can't rely on the data it generates. Not sure if dedicated fitness trackers are any better?

title: Wonderful
comment: After two of us started using this app, we now have about half our company using it. There are a few who use different apps but we all agree this works. So they now say, this is what they were looking for. Its straightforward, simple and with the proper calibration ... efficient.

title: Worked for 5 days
comment: Worked for 5 days but now says I walked 1.2 million miles today.

title: Lightweight and works sometimes
comment: I originally liked the app because it worked well and was lightweight, but now it's just lightweight.  It worked well for about 4 weeks but within the last week it just stops working on its own. Pausing it and then starting it seems to get it to go again but meanwhile there are hours of steps that are not recorded.
Tends to get a but buggy when dealing with large amounts of walking.

title: Sometimes works, sometimes not
comment: Hit and miss. Works about 90 percent of the time, but sometimes just doesn't record anything. Today for instance. 12 steps recorded in 18 hours.

title: Inaccurate with latest version
comment: As far as I could tell, used to be fairly accurate. Now with the latest version, a 7 km walk registered as 2 km, and I get a considerable amount of false positives while driving.

title: Every day it's getting worse
comment: Could be a good app, but it's not

title: Add more features
comment: Please add more features. As well. Developers, please keep your CSV file backup in a proper folder unless cluttering it in the root sdcard folder ...

Well, some versions ago I received bad reviews because the backup file was stored in the proper directory in /Android/de.j4velin.pedometer/ because the users didn't find the file. Now I'm getting "bad" reviews because it's in the root directory. It's impossible to satisfy everybody, sorry

title: Wonderful
comment: Thank you for making a pedometer app for my Nexus 5 that actually works with CyanogenMod 11!

title: Doesn't work
comment: it isn't counting my steps.
Does your device has a step sensor?

title: Works great
comment: Love it

title: Worked great at first, then...
comment: Resets EVERY time I open it and/or restart the phone...The first few months that I used this app were great. Worked well and no issues with it missing steps. Over the past few weeks, however, about 50% of the time it doesn't start counting until I go into the app! This has caused bad data and the many updates since have done nothing to fix this. Will be using something else soon if there is no permanent fix. What a shame.
If you want your issues getting resolved, you need to contact me. I don't have such problems on my device so I can't fix that
I like it

title: Perfect
comment: Simple and effective!
It also works on Oppo Find 7

title: Nice app
comment: Think please about adding more different achievements, for example to walk more each day within a week and, walk more each month and etc. Only 9 is very few.

title: Great app - simple to use
comment: I like this app - its straightforward, reliable, very accurate and easy to use. The only problem I've had is that very occasionally it has stopped counting for no apparent reason. Not hard to fix, but a bit annoying. This hasn't happened often, and overall I am very happy with this app.

title: Still needs fixing
comment: Fix the error which causes previous days data to get lost. If this can't be done allow us to manually correct missing data.

title: Worked better few months ago
comment: I don't understand this app. In the past it tracked better the steps. Now I have days where I have 0 steps. It's like the app was not started....
Still has a few bugs. Counted 60k steps by midday after a 4k max walk.

title: Simple and no unnecessary permissions
comment: I like that it is simple and doesn't require a lot of permissions but I got an UP24 and don't need it anymore. If you could see more of your history I would have given it five stars.

title: Seems to crash every day
comment: Every crash means I lose my steps for the day. So far in 3 days it's crashed and reset every day - Nexus 5
The only reported crashes in the developer console are due to an installed xposed module

title: Didn't work
comment: Installed it and after a day at work and out and about it only said 400 steps.
Is been FC'n un a new phone nexus 5
The only reported crashes in the developer console are due to an installed xposed module

title: OK So Far
comment: I had to firmly tap my phone before it started counting, which likely points to an issue with the hardware step counter. Anyway, I'm happy so far...  It's too bad Google didn't include this or something like it in the default Nexus 5 software package. While reading Wikipedia I discovered this special sensor existed.

title: Nice, Simple
comment: Interface is nice and simple. It has almost null effect on battery drain on my Nexus 5 . Will give 5 star is calories burnt will also be included.

title: Good idea, but...
comment: I'm not sure how accurate this app is.    According to the app, I have already taken 39 step but I have not got out of bed yet.

title: Stopped tracking steps
comment: This app was great for a while! Unfortunately about 2 days ago it has almost completely stopped tracking my steps. As of writing this review it says I've only taken 4 steps, despite it being midday and having had already gotten up and walked around at work quite a bit. Hopefully there will be an update soon addressing this issue.

title: Great
comment: Uses built in hardware pedometer so uses no extra power. I would like to be able to select a previous day and get more info from it like change to distance etc. Basic but good.

title: Meh...
comment: I turned off my phone when I was at around 8k steps and when I turned it back on it said I had 125k steps and when I reset, it gave me 231k steps. It's upsetting since the whole purpose of the app is to keep track of my steps.

title: It works!
comment: Simple design, easy to navigate, doesn't kill my battery. Great app!                             Can you please add a feature to display historical data and not just the last seven days. That would make it five stars in my book!

title: Nice clean design
comment: A very effective clean design let's you see in one glance where you are at

title: No battery drain but quite unrealiable tracking
comment: Often stops tracking steps for no apparent reason. The only way to resume tracking is rebooting the phone.

title: Simple and good.
comment: I like this app - the simplicity of its design is pleasing. Worth installing and using.  Query for J4velin - The first three days stats appear in the history bar chart, however the following two days have been omitted, then it picks up the 6th day again. Any idea why these two days would not have been counted? I'm happy to do a little testing if you have an idea.

title: Nice, simple, and livhtweight
comment: The app is very lightweight and does exactly what I need. My only complaints are that the homescreen widget updates the count rarely, and that steps for the day are not recorded at all when the app is not shutdown gracefully (for example when the os crashes)

title: Please add a reset button for when counting stops
comment: Please add a manual reset button to ensure the app works again if you notice it stops counting your steps, which unfortunately still happens quite frequently. This should be easily possible, right?
Unfortunately the issue is that the sensor simply doesn't report any new steps when that happens. I don't know how to fix that except for a reboot

title: Sucks

title: Resetting count!
comment: Was working fine with my Nexus 5 but count resets approximately half way through the day every day now losing my steps. If the issues can be fixed I'll be happy to raise my rating.  UPDATE: seems to be resetting count after I reach my daily goal or 10000 steps.
Nice interface but gets step count wrong

title: I have moved negative steps?

title: Great on battery.
comment: App works well and is really battery friendly. I did find that if you restart your devise it resets your step count for the day and there isn't a way to add back what was reset.

title: Sigh
comment: Wish it would quit crashing.

title: Good when it works
comment: But once in a while I get error which ruins progress for a day and requires a reboot.  If this gets fixed then five stars

title: Awesome

title: Cool simple app
comment: I love the simplicity of this app and the brilliant battery life. One problem is that my phone stopped picking up on steps after 3,212 steps (android 4.4.4 on nexus 5)
GREAT APP

title: Not bad
comment: It seems to track fairly accurately however, my stats reset mid day when I rebooted my phone.  How can I fix that?  Yes. I used the hardware power button to reboot. AFAIK thats the only way to reboot the nexus 5 natively.

title: Simple!
comment: Does just what it says, simple and to the point.  Well maintained!

title: Fine
comment: Improve the counter,  it doesn't have to measure the phone vibration
The app just reads the values of your hardware step sensor
Awsome app

title: Getting better
comment: Great app, uses pretty much no battery.   Edit: latest update has stopped it functioning correctly, again. I've just walked about ten miles and it says I've taken 300 steps. PS. New graph lib looks great.

title: Driving?
comment: I drove to work the other day and it logged 120,000 steps... It usually works though, but why does driving confuse it?

title: Good app
comment: Works well with Nexus 5....would give 5 🌟 if it had better widgets..

I'd like a way to view my waking history beyond a month back, by swiping through maybe. Could you add an easier way to convert the count into miles instead of km? To keep the step distance the same between units I had to convert 75cm into feet myself and I didn't immediately think to look in that setting to change km to miles. Also, the count seems to stop working sometimes unless I reboot but maybe this is a fault with the pedometer.
Just set your step count in inches and it should display the distance in miles

title: Great
comment: Does exactly what it says every time and doesn't waste battery life. 5 stars for good clean app that does what it says. You don't find that often.

title: Great app!
comment: It's a must have app for Nexus 5 users!
Add myfitnesspal integration
MFB does not provide a public API yet and it would also require adding the internet permission to the app, which I want to avoid for a simple pedometer app..

title: Works for me
comment: Good app, seems to be pretty accurate. I just wish I could manually enter steps after an unexpected reboot clears the whole day, losing upwards of 20k steps is a major bummer.

title: It looks so pretty!
comment: The latest update adds some subtle animations that really make this app stand out. It was great before, its awesome now
Everyday progress is getting lost. Pls. Fix!

title: Installed twice
comment: I installed it months ago, it worked for a couple of weeks and then stopped working. Gave it the benefit of the doubt with new updates and tried again, same thing happened.. Worked perfectly for a bit, but after two weeks it would tell me I walked 5-10 steps after a 3km walk.

title: Needs a better widget
comment: Great app, works as advertised, just needs a proper widget.

title: Great app
comment: Works well, just make sure you set your stride correctly. Also sometimes it adds a double step if the phone bounces in your pocket too much.

title: Utter non sense
comment: I have been using the app for few days but never shows the steps accurately. I took a walk of around five miles today and it just counted 1500 steps which is less than a mile. The app never wake up properly once the phone screen gets locked. Developer's claim of app using nexus5's built in pedometer is doubtful. App fails to utilize the step sensor since UI doesn't count steps 70% of time. Now don't tell me there is problem in the way I walk! I give 1/2 star for this app.
What's doubtful about using the Nexus 5 step sensor? look at the code to the that the app is doing exactly that and nothing else

title: Works well after initial problems
comment: The first week it would stop recording steps at midnight, regularly. Since then it's worked as expected. No extra battery drain noticed, and it does it's one job well.

title: Wonderful
comment: Wonderful app, highly recommended, only drawback is you cannot see km data for previous days.
Cool

title: Completely unreliable
comment: My wife had a fitness band and we were on vacation together doing the same activities for 5 days so I was able to get a pretty good idea of the accuracy of this app and Nexus 5 hardware. On the first day everything seemed to go great; my step count was within 5 percent of my wife's. However, it went down hill from there. The following days there were portions of activities / times that the app failed to count.

title: When its good.....
comment: To be positive first it seems very accurate measuring 2.3 km for exactly the same distance calculated from Google maps. On the bad side: Day 1 measured accurately but then for no reason added a few thou extra steps; day 2 great; Day 3 only acknowledged 32 steps for the 2.3km walk, then added another 30 odd and froze again.  I look forward to Day 4.  Would be 5 star if consistent.

title: Cool.
comment: Can you integrate it with the NEST thermostat so it can learn our wake time? Even driving, at work, at desk events need to shared with other apps, iftt.
Wildly inaccurate. Uninstall.

title: Jednoduchý a zábavný krokomer
comment: Appka je jednoduchá na používanie, presná a vďaka podpore Google Play Games aj zábavná. Môžem súťažiť s ľuďmi o to, kto dá za deň viac krokov a tým pádom človeka aj viac baví kráčať :-)

title: Inconsistent
comment: It works great but sometimes it just randomly resets the day's progress back to 0( happened like 5 times in the last 1 month)

title: Excellent App
comment: Seems to count steps reliably. Had only problem that never produced itself again in which my counts for the day were completely reset. Mind you this was when the 4.4 roll out was happening...  I would recommend this app to anyone with a nexus 5: not to mention that this is an opensource application. Thanks j4elin! Keep up the great work.

title: Used to be great
comment: But since the last few updates it just does not count my steps anymore. For example, on a day like today I walk 12000 to 15000 step at work and it tells me I have taken 989 steps while walking non stop for 7 hours…

title: Could be better but good
comment: The widget doesn't seem to update correctly so it's just a shortcut to the app effectively but it does seem to be counting steps and not using much power.
The widgets updates once an hour or so

title: Massively inaccurate
comment: As much as i appreciate this is using the built in nexus 5 pedometer and there may not be that much the app can do about it... It's just too inaccurate. Fitbit pedometer used for a day 3500 steps, my phone 7500. It even added on 2000 whilst i was in the car 😕

title: Good but....
comment: Counts steps but in the last week and a half it has stopped counting 3 times. The app is still open or on, but no new steps. Requires a forced stop.

title: Not working
comment: The pedometer doesn't work whit galaxy s5. It works in nexus 5 but don't in g5. I have some more installed and this one is the only one that does not work or count very low steps..

title: Every version counts different
comment: The counts are totally different every version.  If it was at least consistent,  I could understand it being off by some steps... But after one version it doubled my steps,  another it dropped to 5 steps a day... I've put up with it for at least 15 versions now. Time to give up and delete

title: Not accurate
comment: Keeps counting even when I'm using public transport.
I don't have any influence on what your step sensor interprets as a step - you need to contact your device manufacturer if you're  unhappy with its accuracy

title: Seems Battery Friendly and pretty accurate
comment: From counting steps, seems to over count by about 7%. But that's good enough for me. Do notice the achievements don't seem to work properly. For example, I have Continual 1 but only used app for 7 days. Also Boots Made For Walking V for 25k in one day. Not done that. Suspect it has summed my steps.

title: Step count reset after reboot
comment: As the title says that's the only problem I am seeing otherwise app is great and straightforward with no extra overhead on battery. Not docking any stars as developer is aware of the issues and constantly working to improve it. Thanks Dev.

title: Works great on my Sony Xperia compact
comment: Count steps with no extra battery usage, and the possibility to add friends and colleagues is a great addition. Like a built in fitbit :)

title: Good app except data wipe
comment: Would be nice to be able to edit the number of steps in previous days - sometimes after reboot data gets wiped for the day

title: Was great
comment: Before latest upgrade this was a simple app that did it's job perfectly. Now it constantly tries to connect with play games. Also now it's prone to omitting a day or two from memory.

I have not found another pedometer app that works as seamlessly as this one, while also providing 95% accuracy in tracking. The ability to adjust step size to ensure proper measurement has been extra nice. I haven't used the achievements and social features so cannot speak to those.
Ok

title: Units?
comment: Why are there decimals in the numbers, and how do I get rid of the cm and km crap?
There is an option to switch to imperial units in the app

comment: Doesn't seem as accurate anymore. Can you add the ability to track steps on an hourly basis too?

title: Reset after phone turned off
comment: What the heck.

title: Like it

title: Great app, 5 stars only if...

I would've gave it 5 stars if it allowed me to pause the counter in such situations. A widget that has this feature would be nice for easy stop n start...

title: So far so good...
comment: Will be 5 stars if it proves to be miserly w/ battery and accurate. To those who say they are having problems with missing counts make sure you have the persistent notification enabled in settings (4.4.2 requires this behavior to keep the Pedometer app from being killed). It doesn't place an icon in the notification bar but does place a step counter notification in the pull-down. If you're like me and like keeping the notifications pull-down clean you can hide the notification for this app by going to Settings>Apps>Pedometer> and uncheck "Show notifications", it SEEMS this gets rid of the notification w/o interfering with its purpose of keeping the app alive in the background all the time. Provided the persistent nature of the app doesn't result in any crazy battery drain I will be bumping my rating up to 5-stars.

title: Neat, but
comment: Just like others have reported, stopped counting on Nexus 5.

Updating the notification and widget is kind of expensive on Android, so no, they aren't updated with every step

title: Need improve

title: Counted 25000 steps in one hour

title: Over counts steps
comment: I did 2000+ steps while driving and not getting off my backside.  It seems to count the slightest movement as a step!  Tried it again.  Same thing but also found that it is a battery killing app.   With it installed and not doing anything used 10% battery in less than 15 minutes.  Uninstalled and recharged battery again and only used 1% battery in the same time with no activity.
The app only reads your sensor data, it has no influence on its sensitivity. Also, the app really uses not much battery - you won't notice it at all in the battery stats

title: Step to this
comment: First I did not know the Nexus 5 had a built in step counter. Not something Google put in the description. Second, this app utilizes that counter to display your steps with no battery drain, a nice looking interface and seems to be pretty accurate.

title: Works well, but...
comment: Works well on nexus 5. Accurately counts steps while moving and uses very little battery.  Unfortunately, as others have noted, it also counts steps while in cars, on buses, etc.  App needs a way to pause counting for those times you know you won't be walking.

title: Best of the bunch

One bug that I found is when I  input my stride length in "feet" it will only display my distance walked in "miles" for the rest of the day. The next morning it will revert back to my stride length in cm and display kilometers walked.

title: Not so good on a bus
comment: Seemed to work fine on Nexus 5 until I went on a bus and it racked up 159807 steps (even converted to kilometers) - not bad for a guy recovering from hip surgery and using 2 crutches!

title: Good, but can be better...
comment: This app works nicely on the Nexus 5, though it misses some steps here and there and sometimes is oversensitive and counts false steps. A setting to change the sensitivity could be nice. Also, if only it could integrate the daily log, like at which time how much workout was done qualitatively, and provide some more info and customizations than just informing my steps. The best thing is there is no issue about the battery... consumption is almost nil. And the step counter sensor really helps.

Would be really nice if I cold scroll left and see my last month of daily activity,  without having to register my personal details.

Could you export your data and see if there is anything wrong? Average just takes your total step value and divides by the number of days with a step value > 0

Do you use a task killer app?

title: Please add Pebble support as soon as you can get one
Great step counter
comment: So far this is the best of the low power/hardware step counter apps. I do hope the developer adds immersive mode/translucent decor, configurable options for the dashclock extension & widget, and MFP integration.

title: Good but...
comment: The desired step count strong control is not so well thought out (difficult to use).  UPDATE: You can type in the goal IF AND ONLY IF you haven't touched anywhere on the control first (while its still highlighted). UPDATE2: You can actually get control back and enter steps but it takes many clicks on a Nexus 5.

You know you can type directly in the text field, right? UPDATE: Just click on the number in the middle to open the keyboard again and then you can change it even if you have touched anywhere else before

title: Counts when driving!
comment: App counts steps when driving on bumpy roads... Tried to provide feedback... Site wouldn't allow me to.
Which site? I can't control the sensivity of the hardware step sensor, sorry

title: Minimalist, but wondeful
comment: Minimalist, but does exactly what it needs to do. Not as fancy - or battery draining - as something like Moves. But has minimal achievement rankings via Play, keeps accurate steps (as checked past my fitbit) and lets you export data to CSV later on. Excellent.

title: Clean, simple, non-intrusive.
comment: PROS: The design is clean and simple to use. Its uncomplicated widget lets me see at a glance how many steps I've taken. It has a lock-screen widget. (Accuracy is, of course, only as good as your hardware.) CONS: I would like an option to remove the goal; for me, it is just an irritation whenever I view the notifications. The reset time should be both customisable and optional; manual reset should be available.
You can resize the widget. The notification has a fixed width, I can not make this any smaller

title: Unfortunately pretty much useless
comment: Out of about 170000 steps (over 8 days before uninstalling), it missed around 43000 compared to my traditional pedometer. That could've been "good enough" if it'd been reasonably consistent. It's not. One day it counted about the same as the traditional, the next it missed nearly half the steps. Conditions were (on purpose) more or less identical on both days.  While I assume the App isn't the culprit, but rather the sensor, it still makes the app useless.

title: Good in theory but inaccurate
comment: Really wanted to like it but the count is really inaccurate. Sometimes I'll get a 1000 steps walking around the house and get 100 step taking a 30 walk.

title: Developer used ignore
comment: It's super effective - 5 stars restored. (app still freaks out on phone reboot, though ;( )
I'm not paying attention to review blackmailer, sorry

title: Works well sometimes
comment: I don't know what's responsible for this, but on some days, it'll count 28000 steps, and on another day with similar movement activity it'll only count 37 steps. How can it be that off?  Feature request: add a pause button for when I'm driving.

title: Good app but ...
comment: I wish you could convert kilometres to miles as it's a bit confusing.  And list calories burnt. Otherwise this is a lightweight application.

title: Great App

title: Very Useful
comment: After my first review, I figured out that its not the APP but the Hardware sensor of my Phone, which is to blame.  Its a great App, if you are walking. I liked the UI very much though. Keep up the good work.
The app just reads the value of the "step sensor" of your Nexus 5. I really can't do anything if your hardware sensor counts wrongs
This is a good app

title: Brilliant

title: Simple and effective

title: Simple but effective

title: Nice
comment: Keep the good work going! title: Awesome app
comment: It does what it says, I find the social side of the app wonderful. Very encouraging. Maybe support for other devices could be the start of something interesting, but for now It's perfect for the nexus 5

title: Excellent up with very low foot print

title: Great stuff!
comment: Works really well on my N5. Just sits in the background and counts steps, you can compare your scores against G+ followers or the wider G+ community. It's simple and fast and just gets on with the job. A few more features would be nice and perhaps more interfacing with other apps - but keep it fast and simple. Great app!

title: Awesome on Nexus 5
comment: Other than the need for a persistent notification I love this app.  This has been noted as necessary because a bug in the current version of Android so someday this may be fixed.

title: Not accurate at all
comment: I came this morning to work walking as usual. It is a 3km distance walk and pedometer just registered 1km.  I had the phone in my pocket, i wear jeans, and I think I walk normal.  Moves was more accurate, but it drained the battery.

title: Good so far
comment: Like the way it uses the Nexus 5 hardware. The achievements need to adhere to locale number format though. It shows 7.500 where as in UK it would be 7,500.

title: Great app
comment: A great app but has issue when signed in with Google+ account. It keeps phone awake all the time so battery drop fast...
Great app

title: Driving
comment: The app registers driving as steps...

title: Not a single permission
comment: And Open Source. That's the way to go!

title: Seems alright so far
comment: I will edit this review after a couple of days use, but there is  one thing I have to comment on immediate.   The daily goal is set to 10000, and the list picker is in increments of 1. ARE YOU F***ING KIDDING ME! Should I spend 5mins scrolling just to change my goal by 10%? That is stupid beyond belief. Please change. Increments of 100 would make a lot more sense. Or even 500. But not 1.
You can type anything you want in the picker, you don't have to scroll

title: App developer is extremely responsive.
comment: I worked with the app developer with debug versions of his app to solve some issues like negative values cropping up, issues with pedometer counting resuming on upcoming days, and other little issues.   As of now, all bugs I know of are fixed.

title: Good but some issues
comment: Seems very accurate and uses very little battery but sometimes needs to be restarted in order to record steps again.

title: 好用
comment: 界面简洁，功耗低。 （评论补充），更新后之前数据没了，更新前切记导出数据啊喂！

title: Still forgetting days
comment: The total is still there but it seems to just "forget" step counts for previous days or rolls them into the same day.

title: Great!
comment: Great simple app. Could use a bit better history viewer to view farther than the past week.

title: No more battery drain!
comment: Tried a few other apps which claimed to use the Nexus5 built in pedometer but they all used GPS in some way and killed my battery, with Pedometer for the past 5 days I have had 0 battery problems.  Other than that it has a clean, effective UI and does exactly what want.  It's even open source!  Awesome.

title: Great!
comment: Has no noticeable effect on battery life whatsoever, and is reasonably accurate.

title: Some bugs but helpful developer
comment: It doesn't kill my battery life and is very simple and clean but it has an irritating bugs due to which my data gets reset.  Luckily the developer is super helpful and is working to fix the issues.
Bug reporting in Google Play reviews really don't make much sense. Please write me an eMail if you want me to send you the debug version

title: Stops tracking
comment: The notification option does not help on stock 4.4.2. It still stops tracking until the app is forced to stop and then restarted.

title: Does exactly like it says
comment: The only thing that would make this better, is a way to integrate into some service that tracks overall health.

title: Seems to count steps well
comment: On my Nexus 5 it works well, except sometimes it stops counting altogether and the phone must be rebooted.
Great design. Gets better with each update

title: Poor
comment: I don't understand all these 5 star reviews, apparently I walked some 7000 steps, now it says I walked - 1. Never mind the fact that I no way walked that far, it makes steps from simply taking my phone out of my pocket. Simply is not accurate and bugged. Uninstalled after 3 days.
The app only reads the hardware step sensor of your device, I really can't do anything about its accuracy

title: Works just as described
comment: Excellent app once again! Thanks for wallpaper changer too :D this app doesn't use any additional battery life on my N5 and doesn't even show up under battery usage. Thanks again :D

title: Please add a Widget
comment: Nice app, but I would love to see a widget.

title: Great app
comment: I'd love to see commas separate the numbers, rather than periods. Or an option to toggle between the two.

title: Awesome
comment: A set it and forget pedometer that uses no battery... Amazing! And it genuinely doesn't use any battery as promised... Nevers shows up in my battery stats.

title: not counting after latest update
comment: it works for a while after reboot. but stops after a while. pls fix it

title: Getting there
comment: Since there seems to be a bug in Kit Kat I can see why the service needed to be restarted every hour. This is getting there however I did notice one thing if phone freezes and need to do a reset.. The data before that was logged was deleted and count resets back to zero

title: Very active dev.
comment: Keep up the good work

title: Not counting
comment: It stopped counting after the latest update.

title: Great Nexus 5 pedometer app
comment: Thank you for making this simple app that uses only nexus 5 pedometer sensor.  *This morning app didn't reset counter, but instead it continued to count on yesterday values. And it is showing 0 value for yesterday.

title: Not accurate
comment: I believe it's the faults of the senser rather than app. but not accurate is true.  Not reliable
great pedo for N5 users

title: -2,147,474,248 steps to go
comment: I got a big negative number in my notification after running the app for a day. The counter inside the app doesn't match with how much I walk. Hopefully fixed in an update.

title: Stopped working
comment: It's an OK app and very good with battery, but it just stopped working. It didn't record any steps for over a day now. It also said that I had -2 billion steps to reach my goal of 10k steps per day in the notification for a while, but not it says 16.882. Please fix this app as it's one of the only ones that work with Nexus 5 without sucking the life out of the battery.

title: very  well
comment: 省电，精确，如果能记录运动时间的时间段就更好了

title: Like it
comment: So simple and nice!

title: Great accuracy
comment: Finally found a lightweight pedometer that works with my Nexus 5! Now I only want this with the interface of Noom Walk, especially the widget and the day by day history.

title: Splendid, reliable app
comment: This app is fantastic and makes me love my Nexus 5 even more. Kudos to the developer, and thanks for supporting open source!

title: No bloat
comment: Exactly what I was looking for, no extra permissions needed. Just counts steps in the most efficient possible way, using the new APIs in KitKat and hardware in the nexus 5. Also, it's open source!

title: Simple
comment: Simple step counter which is all I was looking for.
